meanings.definition: A privilege, gain, or profit incidental to regular salary or wages; bonus.
meanings.sent1: Receiving a perquisite like a company car can make a job even better.
meanings.sent2: The perquisite of working at that company is the annual bonus.
meanings.sent3: It was a perquisite to have access to the exclusive employee lounge.
meanings.sent4: The perquisite of being a teacher is the satisfaction of helping students learn.
meanings.sent5: The perquisite of living in this neighborhood is the beautiful park nearby.

meanings.definition: Something demanded or due as a particular privilege.
meanings.sent1: The perquisite of being a member is attending all the meetings.
meanings.sent2: She considered the perquisite of having her own office a sign of success.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly demanded a perquisite of free coffee for a year.
meanings.sent4: The perquisite of friendship is loyalty and trust.
meanings.sent5: The perquisite of winning the contest was a free trip to Hawaii.
